meanings.sent1: The petulant child pouted when she didn't get her way.
meanings.sent2: She had a petulant expression on her face after losing the game.
meanings.sent3: The petulant puppy refused to eat his dinner until he got a belly rub.
meanings.sent4: Her petulant attitude was like a dark cloud hanging over the family gathering.
meanings.sent5: The petulant customer stormed out of the store, slamming the door behind her.

meanings.definition: Moved to or showing sudden, impatient irritation, especially over some trifling annoyance.
meanings.sent1: He became petulant when his computer froze for a few seconds.
meanings.sent2: The petulant driver honked impatiently at the slow-moving car in front of him.
meanings.sent3: The petulant cat meowed loudly for attention while her owner was on the phone.
meanings.sent4: His petulant outburst startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The petulant student tapped his foot impatiently during the long lecture.
